intro: Galium pycnotrichum, commonly known as the hairy bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically covered with fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Galium pycnotrichum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
